1.text: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,

2.text: How long will it be ere you make an end of words? mark, and afterwards we will speak.

3.text: Why are we counted as beasts, and reputed vile in your sight?

4.text: He tears himself in his anger: shall the earth be forsaken for you? and shall the rock be removed out of his place?

5.text: Yes, the light of the wicked shall be put out, and the spark of his fire shall not shine.

6.text: The light shall be dark in his tabernacle, and his candle shall be put out with him.

7.text: The steps of his strength shall be straitened, and his own counsel shall cast him down.

8.text: For he is cast into a net by his own feet, and he walks on a snare.

9.text: The gin shall take him by the heel, and the robber shall prevail against him.

10.text: The snare is laid for him in the ground, and a trap for him in the way.

11.text: Terrors shall make him afraid on every side, and shall drive him to his feet.

12.text: His strength shall be extremely hungry, and destruction shall be ready at his side.

13.text: It shall devour the strength of his skin: even the firstborn of death shall devour his strength.

14.text: His confidence shall be rooted out of his tabernacle, and it shall bring him to the king of terrors.

15.text: It shall dwell in his tabernacle, because it is none of his: brimstone shall be scattered on his habitation.

16.text: His roots shall be dried up beneath, and above shall his branch be cut off.

17.text: His remembrance shall perish from the earth, and he shall have no name in the street.

18.text: He shall be driven from light into darkness, and chased out of the world.

19.text: He shall neither have son nor nephew among his people, nor any remaining in his dwellings.

20.text: They that come after him shall be astonished at his day, as they that went before were affrighted.

21.text: Surely such are the dwellings of the wicked, and this is the place of him that knows not God.
